data.text: @enews But..... he still did it .......Fucked up
@enews A series of unfortunate events..:(
@enews Such a misleading article title- doesn’t media reporting have ethics anymore? Or this a blogging writer?
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews I was a fan in the early years.  Not so much towards the end.
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews Losing a child is horrible no matter the circumstances.
@miriamjablon @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews That's more believable.
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews Wikipedia is saying 3 Million.
@Gloritone @miriamjablon @blsrob9 @enews Very true
@miriamjablon @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews Absolutely.  We have to remember he was someone's son. I can't imagine what they're going through
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews The Mirror is not known for it’s accuracy.

@Gloritone @blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews I was a huge fan of Glee. I was invested in the characters. It broke my heart when I heard of his arrest. I had to remind myself Mark is not his character.  I grieved his character,  not him
@Gloritone @cc19348 @blsrob9 @enews Sad all the way around.
@miriamjablon @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews  https://t.co/gq1DSpX9HI
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews That seems more likely.

@cc19348 @blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews For me, the eerie thing is the story showed up on my timeline the same day I was reading about Peter Scully. I’m not overly familiar with Mark, but initially felt sorry about the suicide. But any crimes against children is the worst.
I’m waiting for the Philippines to end Scully.
@enews Does that mean his victims get nothing??
@miriamjablon @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews I thought it was high as well. I googled his net worth. I was thinking 2 million.
@cc19348 @Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews $275 Million?  Are you sure?  That seems a bit high.

@Gloritone @blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews To have such great gifts...musician, his voice was beautiful, then throw it all away for something so despicable is beyond me. I can't wrap my head around it. Demons doesn't begin to describe it

@cc19348 @blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews Yes, def a strange story and sad ending.
I can't even imagine having two mil. let alone two hundred. So much money, yet people can be lead astray....

@Gloritone @blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews He was worth about $275 million. No amount of money is going to make the victim's whole again. But it's better than nothing. He plead guilty. Now he's gone. The only left is $$. It's a shame. I never would've guessed that was going on. Only knowing his character, he was easy to❤
@enews Of course  you can't  flog a dead horse.

@miriamjablon @blsrob9 @enews Thanks for clarifying Miriam! 🙂
The families want their day in court, and $$$.
@Gloritone @blsrob9 @enews Selena, he plead guilty.  There was no doubt.  Just asked a lawyer friend of mine.  Rob is correct.
@enews Well... it’s kinda hard to go forward with him being dead and all..☠️
@enews Loool because they could have continued with the case and arrested his corpse?

@blsrob9 @miriamjablon @enews Thank-You, Rob. It makes more sense now.
Sad for Mark's family/friends/fans - I'm not familiar with his music/Glee, but any crime against children is the worst/unforgivable. When I heard about the case being dismissed, it just solidified his guilt to me.
@miriamjablon @blsrob9 @enews They were probably in the process of filing.
@blsrob9 @Gloritone @enews Ah.  I had not thought of that.  Couldn’t they have sued him when he was alive though?
@Gloritone @enews Also, why would they reopen it?  Why waste taxpayer money?  He is dead.  I have his solo album.  It’s good. Too bad.
@Gloritone @enews I think so too. When a dear friend of mine died & she had been working on her MSW, her family was given her degree instead. It was very nice

@miriamjablon @enews I should look it up. I thought it was procedural as well. Then, I saw this part, which confused me. "Prosecutors requested to dismiss the case "without prejudice," meaning it could later be refiled"
I think it's for the family's state of mind, but I have limited knowledge here
@enews Duh?!
@Gloritone @enews I don’t know.  It could just be a procedural thing.
@enews That’s nice of them not to prosecute his corpse...

@miriamjablon @enews I'm not sure either. 
Sounds like PR damage-control, even though timing is off.
@enews Case dismissed does not equal innocence/excuse whatever happened  though.
@enews No shit he’s dead
@enews Cool
@enews NO WAY WHAT REALLY . IS THIS TRUE??? https://t.co/t3Hs6Lo27J
@enews You think 🙄
